type.context: GOVERNMENT LOTTERIES ACT under Power to organise and conduct Government lotteries. 3. type.name: section
type.title: Constitution of Committee.
type.context: GOVERNMENT LOTTERIES ACT under Constitution of Committee. 4.  (1) The Committee shall consist of not more than five members appointed by the Minister one of whom shall be a public officer.  (2) The Minister shall appoint one of the members other than the public officer to be the Chairman of the Committee and he shall preside at  all meetings.   In the absence of the Chairman from any meeting the members present shall elect one of their number to preside at that meeting. (3) Three members shall form a quorum at any meeting.

type.name: section
type.title: Remuneration of members of Committee.
type.context: GOVERNMENT LOTTERIES ACT under Remuneration of members of Committee. 5.  A member of the Committee other than a public officer shall be paid such remuneration, and allowances (if any) as the Minister may determine.
type.description: A member of the Committee other than a public officer shall be paid such remuneration, and allowances (if any) as the Minister may determine.

type.name: section
type.title: Tenure of office of members of Committee.
type.context: GOVERNMENT LOTTERIES ACT under Tenure of office of members of Committee. 6.  (1) A member other than a public officer shall hold office for one year and shall be eligible for re-appointment.  (2) Any member other than the public officer, may, by writing under his hand addressed to the Minister, resign from the Committee.  (3) The Minister may grant leave of absence to any member of the Committee.

type.name: section
type.title: Proceeds of Government lotteries.
type.context: GOVERNMENT LOTTERIES ACT under Proceeds of Government lotteries. 7.  (1) All  moneys  received  from  the  sale  of  tickets  in  every Government  lottery  shall  be  paid  into  a  deposit  account  in  the Accountant Generals Department and such account shall be called the Government Lotteries Account.  (2) In respect of each Government lottery there shall be paid out of the Government Lotteries Account the LAWS OF GUYANA 6 Cap. 80:07                                                                                                                   Government Lotteries                                     L.R.O. 1/2012                   Regulations.                              prizes and all other charges connected therewith. If at any time the sum standing to the credit of the Government Lotteries Account is insufficient to meet, either wholly or in part, the payment of the prizes in respect of a Government lottery or any charges connected therewith, the deficit shall be made good out of the Consolidated Fund which is hereby charged with such payment.  (3) At the end of each financial year there shall be paid into the Development Fund of Guyana, after allowing for all expenses and the amount reserved for prizes, the amount standing to the credit of the Government Lotteries Account.

(3) If, at the time when a draw is postponed under paragraph (2) (c), one or more, but not all, of the digits necessary to determine the number of a winning ticket shall have been drawn, the number of that ticket shall, when the draw is resumed, be drawn afresh as to all its digits, and the digit or digits drawn before the postponement of the draw shall be disregarded.  (4) For the purpose of witnessing a draw of a lottery the public shall be admitted to the premises upon which the draw is conducted so far as may reasonably be practicable having regard to the accommodation available for such purpose.
